Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ, ZrO(2):Y(2)O3) was deposited on (100) silicon by two physical vapor deposition techniques: pulsed laser deposition (PLD) and reactive magnetron sputtering (RMS).
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: PLD thin films were grown on silicon substrates at 500 degrees C from the ablation of a 8YSZ ceramic target by a KrF excimer laser.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: RMS thin films were obtained by direct current magnetron sputtering of a Zr/Y metallic target in an oxygen/argon atmosphere.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: The deposition rate of the PLD technique using an UV excimer laser delivering pulses at a repetition rate of 40 Hz was found two orders of magnitude lower than the RMS method one.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: Both techniques led to the growth of crystalline films with a (111) preferential orientation.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: PLD films were dense and featureless whereas RMS ones exhibited well defined but compact columnar structure.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering

Sentencas: Growth of a YSZ film of about 1 mu m covering a rough and porous commercial anode support (NiO-YSZ cermet) was successfully carried out with both methods.
Titulo: Yttria-stabilized zirconia thin films deposited by pulsed-laser deposition and magnetron sputtering
